result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Harvey

records.addlTxt: Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant must report to the Pierce County Day Report Center for fingerprints and photograph.

10:10 AM Defendant Michael Harvey in Court pro se.  Assistant District Attorney Kaley Walker in Court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights.  State requests $10,000.00 signature bond.  No objection.  Court orders bond as requested.  Court advises Defendant of right to speedy Preliminary Hearing.  Defendant waives.  Defendant plans on retaining counsel.  Adjourned at 10:15 AM
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
